titles.title: To extend nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of Cambodia, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 104-160.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 77.

action.text: Mr. Crane moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Gibbons objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

calendar.text: Committee on Finance. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Finance. Reported to Senate by Senator Roth with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. With written report No. 104-264.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 398.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Crane asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendment.

vote.text: On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/25/1996--Passed Senate amended. Amends the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States to extend nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment) to the products of Cambodia. Requires the President to report to the Congress within 18 months on the trade relations between the United States and Cambodia pursuant to the trade agreement described in this Act.
